Resources > Webinars

Thought leadership webinars and live demos

Zscaler webinars and demos provide insight into the most topical issues around the threat landscape, cloud‑based security and access, and business transformation. Join a live webinar or a demo to ask questions directly to experts, or watch a previously recorded webinar any time. Either way, itâs free.

Recently recorded webinars

SD-WAN and Security - What You Really Need to Know

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Dhawal Sharma, Senior Director of Product Management, Zscaler

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Jen Toscano, Senior Product Marketing Manager, Zscaler

Join this webinar to explore your SD-WAN security options and obstacles, and see how you can deliver secure SD-WAN and secure local internet breakouts across your enterprise.

WATCH NOW

 

How I transformed a global network and survived

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Thomas Vavra, Manager Communication Networks, Mondi Group

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Naresh Kumar, Principal Product Manager, Zscaler

As a rapidly growing company with over 26,000 users and 100 locations across 30 countries, Mondi Group found that backhauling internet traffic over MPLS to centralized gateways was no longer meeting its needs. Securely managing growth and addressing the security challenges of folding in new acquisitions required a complete transformation, from a legacy hub-and-spoke network to a modern direct-to-cloud architecture.

WATCH NOW

 

Three reasons SDP will replace VPN in 2019

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Steve Bonek, IT Security Manager, TRIMEDX

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Kunal Shah, Principal Product Manager, Zscaler

Made for data center applications and a workforce of 30 years ago, the network-centric VPN was built to secure a world that no longer exists. Itâs 2019 and your users are mobile, enterprise applications have migrated to the cloud, and the VPN canât deliver the secure remote access needed in this new world of user-to-app connectivity.

Join Steve Bonek, IT Security Manager at TRIMEDX, and Kunal Shah, Principal Product Manager at Zscaler, as they discuss the three reasons why the software-defined perimeter (SDP) is replacing VPN in 2019.

WATCH NOW

 

Top 5 security predictions for 2019

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Stan Lowe, CISO, Zscaler

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Bil Harmer, CISO, Zscaler

As security professionals, how can we be sure that weâre ready for 2019? After the last few years, when our practices and conventions have been tested again and again, itâs a little daunting to consider what may face us in the year ahead. Will attackers set their sights on cloud apps? Will hackers join forces with organized crime? Will governments look to the private sector to deal with the skills gap? What will happen to cybersecurity budgets? Look for answers to these questions and more as Zscaler CISOs Stan Lowe and Bil Harmer present their security predictions for 2019. Join us!

 

WATCH NOW

 

Gambling on security does not pay off!

Spend 15 minutes learning to enable secure, direct-to-cloud connections

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Naresh Kumar, Principal Product Manager, Zscaler

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Jen Toscano, Sr. Product Marketing Manager, Zscaler

As you embark upon your cloud transformation journey, youâll quickly learn that traditional network security is far from a safe bet. In this 15-minute webinar, we will explore why a comprehensive security platform that can deliver identical security for all users wherever they connect is fundamental to a successful cloud-first strategy.

 

WATCH NOW

 

You can't move legacy to the cloud

Join this 15-minute webinar to see why cloud security architectures are not created equal

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Naresh Kumar, Principal Product Manager, Zscaler

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Jen Toscano, Sr. Product Marketing Manager, Zscaler

To give users fast access to cloud apps, many organizations are turning to local internet breakouts. But, what is the best way to secure these direct-to-internet connections? In this 15-minute webinar, we will quickly review the challenges of virtualized appliance solutions and the ways you can best achieve the security, visibility, and control you need in your branch offices.

WATCH NOW

 

Kelly Services: Lessons learned from deploying a global network to support O365

How to successfully deploy Office 365 and maximize application performance

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Rob Wilber, Director, Global Networks and Telecom, Kelly services

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Dan Shelton , Director of Product Management, Zscaler

What happens to your network architecture when you deploy Microsoft Office 365 to thousands of users around the globe? A lot. Office 365 applications place big demands on your network and there are a lot of ways to get it wrong. From Skype, to SharePoint, to Teams or OneDrive, the robust functionally of Office 365 requires new ways of thinking about your network and connectivity. In this webinar, Robb Wilber, Director Global Networks and Telecom at Kelly Services, and Dan Shelton, Zscaler Director of Product Management, will share the lessons they learned while supporting an Office 365 deployment across a global footprint of 900 offices in 22 countries.

WATCH NOW

 

Deliver a Seamless and Secure Office 365 User Experience

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Dan Shelton, Product Management , Zscaler

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Nick Fisher, Solutions Marketing, Okta

While Office 365 holds the promise of increased productivity and costs saving, migrating your IT environment to Office 365 can be a monumental task and introduce new security risks. Join Dan Shelton from Zscaler and Nick Fisher from Okta to learn how to quickly enable your workforce with Office 365 while mitigating the risks that often come with it.

WATCH NOW

 

Transforming the network with SD-WAN

Find out in 15 minutes what you need to secure your SD-WAN deployment

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Amit Raikar, Sr. Director of Business Development, Zscaler

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Jen Toscano, Sr. Product Marketing Manager, Zscaler

Are you considering an SD-WAN implementation? Youâre not alone! Many organizations are turning to SD-WAN to take full advantage of SaaS, cloud applications like Office 365, and mobility. In this 15-minute webinar, we will introduce the advantages and challenges of leveraging SD-WAN, and why security is the key to successful branch and network transformation with SD-WAN.

 

WATCH NOW

 

How the World's First FedRAMP Authorized Zero Trust Cloud Solution Simplifies Remote Access

KEYNOTE SPEAKER: Stephen Kovac, Vice President of Global Government and Compliance, Zscaler

GUEST SPEAKER: Lisa Lorenzin, Director, Emerging Technology Solutions, Zscaler

For years TIC and VPN were the primary solutions to optimize and standardize security for remote users looking to access agency applications. Today, the government is transforming. Apps are migrating onto the government cloud and agency workers are mobile. This uncharted territory requires agencies to rethink how to secure remote access to apps for all users, devices, and locations and do so based on zero trust.

WATCH NOW

 

BROWSE ALL PREVIOUSLY RECORDED WEBINARS >

Your Mission

The Cloud-First Architect™

Secure cloud transformation begins with architects

Architecting for a cloud and mobile-first world

More than ever, enterprises are relying on architects to help them embrace digital transformation. Architects play a critical role in identifying the right technologies to ensure agility, security, and competitive differentiation in this new IT frontier.

Zscaler is here to help.

Content for architects, by architects

Zscaler architects share insights and best practices to help you with various aspects of your cloud strategy. Weâll tackle high-priority issues like scaling SSL/TLS, implementing a software-defined perimeter (SDP) for zero trust, and designing for a multi-cloud environment.

Zscaler security platform and architecture

Understanding the
SDP architecture

Securing
multi-cloud access

Explore Content

Engage with Zscaler architects

Zscaler architects have guided thousands of organizations through their application, network, and security transformations to the cloud. They're ready to share their expertise to help you securely navigate your own transformation initiatives.

Join Zenith Community, Zscaler's open forum for architects, by architects.

Engage Now

If you would like to understand how Zscaler can be used to secure your cloud environment, we encourage you to request a Zscaler architectural workshop.

#####EOF##### Zscaler Private Access for VPN Alternatives | Solutions

Solution Brief

Zscaler Private Access
for VPN Alternative

The IT world has evolved. It’s time for application access to evolve as well.

For almost 30 years, enterprises have relied on the remote access VPN to connect remote users to the internal LAN. But the way users work has changed. They can now use the cloud to connect to any application, on any device, and from anywhere—without the need for a VPN.

We now live in a world of cloud and mobility, yet many organizations are still trying to provide secure remote access to applications using network security solutions, like the VPN. It’s time to adopt a modern, scalable approach—one that enables secure remote access to private applications in the cloud and data center.

This solution brief explains why it’s time to consider an alternative to your remote access VPN. You will learn:


  • How cloud and mobility make the remote access VPN an outdated technology
  • Why remote access VPNs inherently place your network at risk
  • How to embrace software-defined access and deliver enhanced security and a seamless user experience
  • Why enterprises are replacing VPNs with Zscaler Private Access

Fill the form below

Â©2008-2019 Zscaler, Inc. All rights reserved. | Privacy Policy

Your Mission
Company > About Zscaler

Cloud from the beginning.
Built for the future.

Zscaler security as a service is delivered through
a purpose-built, globally distributed platform.

Zscaler Platform

The story behind Zscaler

Weâre on a mission to make the internet your new secure corporate network.

Back in the day when your users were all on the network and your applications resided in your physical data center, it made sense to establish a secure perimeter around your network. But those days are over, the perimeter is gone, and network security is all but irrelevant.

Instead, you need to put your defenses and controls where the connections occurâ the internet â so that every connection is fast and secure, no matter how or where users connect or where their applications reside.

By moving applications and infrastructure to the cloud and untethering employees from their desks, you can realize tremendous advantages in productivity, agility, and cost containment. With our 100% cloud built secure platform, Zscaler can help you make the move to the cloud, securely.

Zscaler Corporate Overview

Explore the Zscaler global Security Cloud

Securing the Global 2000

Organizations running the worldâs most complex networks are those that most quickly realize the benefits of Zscaler cloud-delivered security as a service.

Siemens, for example, uses Zscaler to secure all the traffic of its 350,000 users in more than 180 countries. In the UK, National Health Services secures more than a million users through the Zscaler cloud. And MCNC, the educational network in North Carolina, runs 53 Gbps of bandwidth through Zscaler in support of its 1.2 million users.

Zscaler customers, whether theyâre supporting a lot of users, a lot of locations, a lot of bandwidth, or all of the above, rely on Zscaler to secure all their connections and provide the scale they need to operate efficiently and keep users happy and productive.

Zscaler Architecture

Zscaler leadership

Meet Zscalerâs management team, as well as its board of directors and investors

Join the Zscaler team

The cloud is transforming business. It can transform you, too.

When you put talented people in a company that rewards innovative thinking, great things happen. And great things are happening at Zscaler. Join us as we help organizations around the world embrace the power and agility of the cloud using Zscaler security as a service.

Zero trust security

Make it possible

Your Mission
Company > Compliance

Confidence through compliance

Zscaler adheres to rigorous security and availability standards, so that customers may adopt our services with confidence.

The Zscaler Security Cloud was built with compliance in mind.

We are committed to ensuring that our global customers and partners are able to meet diverse compliance requirements.

ISO 27001

Zscaler has achieved the ISO 27001 certificate, attesting that our services are based on internationally recognized best practices for information security management systems.
View Zscalerâs Certification

ISO 27001

Zscaler has achieved the ISO 27001 certificate, attesting that our services are based on internationally recognized best practices for information security management systems.
View Zscalerâs Certification

Service Organization Control (SOC) 2, Type II certification

The SOC 2, Type II certification provides independent validation that our security controls are in accordance with the American Institute of Certified Public Accountantsâ applicable Trust Services Principles and Criteria.
View Zscalerâs Certification

Service Organization Control (SOC) 2, Type II certification

The SOC 2, Type II certification provides independent validation that our security controls are in accordance with the American Institute of Certified Public Accountantsâ applicable Trust Services Principles and Criteria.
View Zscalerâs Certification

FedRAMP

Zscaler Private Access (ZPA) and Zscaler Internet Access (ZIA) have received an official authorized status Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP) â Moderate Authority to Operate (ATO), also making it ITAR compliant.
View Zscalerâs Authorization

FedRAMP

Zscaler Private Access (ZPA) and Zscaler Internet Access (ZIA) have received an official authorized status Federal Risk and Authorization Management Program (FedRAMP) â Moderate Authority to Operate (ATO), also making it ITAR compliant.
View Zscalerâs Authorization

FIPS 140-2

Zscaler is compliant with the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS 140-2), meeting NIST requirements for cryptographic modules.
View Zscalerâs Certificates #3154 for Zscaler Mobile Cryptographic Module and #3159 for Zscaler Crypto Module

FIPS 140-2

Zscaler is compliant with the Federal Information Processing Standard (FIPS 140-2), meeting NIST requirements for cryptographic modules.
View Zscalerâs Certificates #3154 for Zscaler Mobile Cryptographic Module and #3159 for Zscaler Crypto Module

CSA - Star

As a founding member of the Cloud Security Alliance (CSA), Zscaler has received the Security, Trust & Assurance Registry (STAR) certification.
View Zscaler's self-assessment

CSA - Star

As a founding member of the Cloud Security Alliance (CSA), Zscaler has received the Security, Trust & Assurance Registry (STAR) certification.
View Zscaler's self-assessment

GDPR

Zscaler is committed to enable you to successfully comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) requirements through a strong partnership between Zscaler (data processor) and your organization (data controller).
Learn more about GDPR

GDPR

Zscaler is committed to enable you to successfully comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) requirements through a strong partnership between Zscaler (data processor) and your organization (data controller).
Learn more about GDPR

ISO 27018

ISO/IEC 27018:2014 is a code of practice that focuses on protection of personal data in the cloud. It is based on ISO/IEC information security standard 27002 and provides implementation guidance on ISO/IEC 27002 controls applicable to public cloud Personally Identifiable Information (PII)
View Zscalerâs Certification

ISO 27018

ISO/IEC 27018:2014 is a code of practice that focuses on protection of personal data in the cloud. It is based on ISO/IEC information security standard 27002 and provides implementation guidance on ISO/IEC 27002 controls applicable to public cloud Personally Identifiable Information (PII)
View Zscalerâs Certification

Data privacy and security are integral to Zscaler

Zscaler ensures that millions of employees at thousands of enterprise and government organizations worldwide are protected against cyberattacks and data breaches. Each organization faces unique regulatory challenges based upon industry, geography, and other factors, and the Zscaler platform is designed to simplify compliance and reporting, globally. Each day, over 200 of the Forbes Global 2000 organizations in more than 185 countries rely on Zscaler.

Read About Our Cloud Platform

Our focus on security

Security is at the heart of the services we offer customers, and as a company we also rely on Zscaler security to protect against malicious attacks and data loss. Not surprisingly, security is central to our company and culture. For more information regarding our compliance practice email us at compliance@zscaler.com.

Security awareness

At Zscaler, we follow industry best practices and we require all employees to undergo extensive annual security trainings. We continuously strive to improve our security programs and controls and seek feedback from customers, body auditors, and internal teams. Because we believe that security and strategic initiatives should be closely aligned, our CISO reports to the Chief Strategy Officer.

Secure product development and maintenance

We have implemented security checks across our development lifecycle and our product is continuously evaluated by internal security teams and external auditors. Our cloud platform is monitored in real time and we provide publicly available insight into the performance and health of our service, globally. In addition, we perform regular vulnerability scans, risk assessments, and penetration tests to maintain the highest standards of security and availability.

Securing customer information

Customer information is protected in accordance with best-of-breed frameworks and standards like ISO 27001. We guarantee that the customer transaction content we inspect as part of our service offering is never written to disk and logs are never stored in clear text.

Our dedicated research team analyzes threats we see across our security cloud and investigates the global threat landscape. We share our research and cloud data with the industry at large to help promote a safer internet.

Learn More

Get real-time insight into our operations

Our customers entrust us with securing their internet connections, and we take that responsibility seriously. Thatâs why we believe in transparency, offer a window into the health of the platform to anyone at any time, showing operational status, upcoming maintenance windows, incidents, and security advisories, along with historical data.

Explore the Trust Portal

Check your internet security with Zscaler Security Preview

Check Security Now

Zero trust security

Make it possible

Your Mission
Solutions > SD-WAN

SD-WAN makes local breakouts easy.
Zscaler makes them secure.

Zscaler delivers fast internet access and
SD-WAN security for all of your branches.

Read the eBook Read Industry Report

Zscaler Internet Access and SD-WAN

Traditional routing and security have outlived their relevance

Hub-and-spoke architectures cannot deliver the fast user experience required for the growing use of cloud apps.Cloud apps demand direct-to-internet connections. But, providing SD-WAN security with appliances is expensive.

Reduce costs and complexity

Zscaler and SD-WAN enable secure local internet breakouts without the cost and complexity of traditional network and security appliances.

Deploying boxes everywhere complicates operations

Deploying and managing security appliances or VNFs at each of your branches is costly and time consuming. Plus, network security appliances werenât built to meet the demands of modern cloud apps.

Simplify IT operations

Zscaler and SD-WAN simplify branch operations by delivering security as a cloud service and using software-defined policies to route traffic.

Compromises create
security vulnerabilities

You canât afford to recreate your security stack at every branch. Cost and complexity force companies to sacrifice security by deploying only URL filtering or bypassing SSL inspection, which leaves branches vulnerable.

Security and scale

Zscaler provides identical protection for users wherever they connect.

Traditional routing and security have outlived their relevance

Hub-and-spoke architectures cannot deliver the fast user experience required for the growing use of cloud apps.Cloud apps demand direct-to-internet connections. But, providing SD-WAN security with appliances is expensive.

Reduce costs and complexity

Zscaler and SD-WAN enable secure local internet breakouts without the cost and complexity of traditional network and security appliances.

Deploying boxes everywhere complicates operations

Deploying and managing security appliances or VNFs at each of your branches is costly and time consuming. Plus, network security appliances werenât built to meet the demands of modern cloud apps.

Simplify IT operations

Zscaler and SD-WAN simplify branch operations by delivering security as a cloud service and using software-defined policies to route traffic.

Compromises create
security vulnerabilities

You canât afford to recreate your security stack at every branch. Cost and complexity force companies to sacrifice security by deploying only URL filtering or bypassing SSL inspection, which leaves branches vulnerable.

Security and scale

Zscaler provides identical protection for users wherever they connect.

SD-WAN simplifies branch operations and efficiently connects your branches to the internet. This makes establishing local breakouts easy. But those connections still need to be secured. Thatâs why you need Zscaler Internet Access. We deliver the entire security stack as a cloud security service to secure your direct-to-internet connections.

Zscaler: Enabling SD-WAN security for
all your branches

Zscaler secures the best in SD-WAN

Together with our SD-WAN partners, Zscaler makes it easy to migrate from hub-and-spoke to a cloud-enabled architecture by enabling secure local internet breakouts for your branches. Zscaler partners with the worldâs leading SD-WAN providers to help our customers reduce the cost and complexity of routing traffic locally and securely, simplify branch operations, and scale to meet their unique business needs.

#####EOF##### SD-WAN and Security - What You Really Need to Know | Webinar

ON-DEMAND WEBINAR

SD-WAN and Security - What You Really Need to Know

Organizations are increasingly turning to local breakouts and using SD-WAN to reduce MPLS costs, simplify branch IT, increase agility, and deliver an improved user experience. But securing SaaS and internet-bound traffic for all users at all locations, without compromising on security, can present significant obstacles. If unaddressed, these challenges can undermine the intended benefits of your SD-WAN deployment and can potentially lead to deployment hurdles raised by your security team.

Join this webinar, where Dhawal Sharma, Sr. Director of Product Management at Zscaler, and Jen Toscano, Sr. Product Marketing Manager at Zscaler, will explore your SD-WAN security options and obstacles, and show how you can deliver secure SD-WAN and secure local internet breakouts across your enterprise. In this webinar, we will discuss:

  • Key factors driving the adoption of SD-WAN
  • Why security must change to support SD-WAN
  • The best approach to deliver secure SD-WAN and direct-to-internet connections

About the Speakers:
Dhawal Sharma has more than 10 years of hands-on product management experience in the fields of internet and cloud Security, networking, data path, IoT, NFV, DLP and compliance, NPM and user experience monitoring.
Jen Toscano has more than 10 years of hands-on product marketing experience in the fields of internet and cloud security, access control, threat prevention, mobile security, biometrics and multi-factor authentication, security management, and compliance.

Play Webinar

Â©2008-2019 Zscaler, Inc. All rights reserved. | Privacy Policy

ZPA Interactive

Free hosted demo experience

The path to secure remote access awaits.

Your Free Interactive Experience of Zscaler Private Access

ZPA Interactive is a free hosted demo of our Zscaler Private Access (ZPA) service. It enables you to take ZPA for 7 days test drive and experience the full power of the service from both an administratorâs and end userâs perspective, via a pre-configured environment.

How to get started?

Fill out the form below and your ZPA Interactive hosted demo will be automatically provisioned and emailed to you. Weâll send you âPro Tipsâ along the way so you can get the most out of your experience.

What is Zscaler Private Access?

ZPA is a cloud service used by enterprises to provide secure remote access to internal applications. The software-defined perimeter requires no appliances, improves user experience, and reduces costs and complexity. All without placing users on the network.

Zscaler Awards

Information Management Awards 2018

Zscaler won the "Top 3 New Asia Pacific Security & Data Protection Vendors" award at the NWA Information Management Awards 2018. âThis award recognizes the huge potential that Zscaler has to offer to organizations in Asia Pacific, especially in the area of cybersecurity and data protection in the cloud,â said Victor Ng, enterprise group editor at Questex Asia, the publisher of NetworkWorld Asia and organizer of the Awards.

EY Entrepreneur Of The Year 2018 Award in Northern California

On June 8, 2018, Zscaler CEO Jay Chaudhry was honored with the EY Entrepreneur Of The Year 2018 Award in the Public Companies in Tech category in Northern California at a gala held at the Fairmont San Francisco Hotel. The EY Entrepreneur Of The Year Awards recognize entrepreneurs who are excelling in areas such as innovation, financial performance and personal commitment to their businesses and communities.

Zscaler Is Named to Second Annual Forbes 2017 Cloud 100 List

Zscaler is named to the Forbes 2017 Cloud 100 list, the definitive list of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world, published by Forbes in collaboration with Bessemer Venture Partners. The evaluation process involved four factors: estimated valuation (30%), operating metrics (20%), people & culture (15%) and market leadership (35%), which the judge panel then weighed to select, score and rank the winners. âThis recognition validates our vision that security must follow the apps and be deployed in the cloud,â said Jay Chaudhry, our CEO and founder.

Morgan Stanley Awards Zscaler Prestigious CTO Award

Zscaler was awarded Morgan Stanleyâs prestigious âCTO Award for Innovation.â Each year Morgan Stanley honors one technology solution it deems to be innovative and which made a significant impact on Morgan Stanley's business. Zscaler received the CTO Innovation Award for its cloud-based security solution designed to protect the rapidly evolving mobile and wireless needs of Morgan Stanleyâs financial advisor employee base.

Forbes Cloud 100 award

Forbes named Zscaler #25 on its 2016 Cloud 100, the definitive list of the top 100 private cloud companies in the world, produced in collaboration with Bessemer Venture Partners and Salesforce Ventures. The list profiles top-tier, private companies leading the cloud technology revolution. With advancements in software, cloud security or platform development, the companies included are redefining the future of all industries and sectors.

CRN Tech Innovator 2016

The CRN Tech Innovator awards recognize the most innovative products of 2016. Our unique approach to remote access technology earned Zscaler Private Access recognition as the most innovative cloud security product of the year due to its disruption of legacy VPN technology. As an alternative to VPN gateways, ZPA provides remote users with on-demand access to specific applications, making it more secure than VPN by reducing the potential attack surface.

Best Cloud Computing Security Solution 2016

Zscaler Cloud Firewall wonÂ the Best Cloud Computing Security Solution award by SC Magazine. Each year, the SC Awards honor the most outstanding contributions in the information security industry. Cloud computing security concerns are numerous for both providers and their customers â and include security and privacy worries, compliance issues and legal/contractual problems. These technologies are deployed to protect data and/or applications in a cloud environment. They may also protect the cloud computing infrastructure itself. Solutions or services in this category can proÂ­vide for the protection of data or applications in the cloud, protection for traffic flowing between companies and their cloud service providers, policy management and encrypÂ­tion capabilities, privileged user access and controls or more.

Zscaler chosen Winner in the Tech Trailblazer âSecurityâ category.

Tech Trailblazers is a new concept in awards, designed explicitly for startups that are five years old or less. The awards recognize startup innovation and proactively help startups grow their businesses with access to exclusive coaching, mentoring and development and prizes. Zscaler is a proud winner of the Security Trailblazers award.

Reader Trust Award â Best Cloud Computing Security Solution 2014

Zscaler won the Best Cloud Computing Security Solution award by SC Magazine. These technologies are deployed to protect data and/or applications in a cloud environment. They may also protect the cloud computing infrastructure itself. Cloud computing security concerns are numerous for both providers and their customers, and include security and privacy worries, compliance issues and legal/contractual problems. Solutions or services in this category can provide for the protection of data or applications in the cloud, protection for traffic flowing between companies and their cloud service providers, policy management and encryption capabilities, privileged user access and controls or more.

Best New Product â CEO World Awards 2013

The annual CEO World Awards program encompasses the worldâs best in leadership, innovation, organizational performance, new products and services, CEO case studies, and customer satisfaction programs from every major industry in the world.

Emerging Security Vendors â CRN 2013

Zscaler has been selected by UBM Channel and CRN as a 2013 Emerging Technology Vendor. The annual list features the most innovative vendors who not only deliver technology that is easy to use, but can generate the high margins solution providers require.

Zscaler â 2013 Red Herring Top 100 North America winner in "Security" category

"Selected from among the 3,000 tech startups financed each year in the U.S. and Canada. Winners selected based on technological innovation, management strength, market size, investor record, customer acquisition and financial health. Red Herring has been selecting promising start-ups and ""scale ups"" since 1996. Previous notable winners include Google, Facebook, Twitter, Skype and eBay. See the full list of 2013 Red Herring Top 100 North America winners here."

SC Magazine Innovation Awards 2013

Zscaler is on the shortlist for the Innovation award at the forthcoming SC Awards Europe 2013. The SC Awards Europe are the most coveted and prestigious awards for the information security industry and they honour professionals working to secure enterprises and the vendor and channel communities that deliver innovative security technologies.

Zero trust security

Make it possible

Your Mission
Solutions > Guest Wi-Fi Security

Is your guest Wi-Fi network becoming a liability?

Protect your guest Wi-Fi network in minutes.
100% in the cloud. No hardware. No mess.

Request Demo

Eliminate security loopholes and inappropriate downloads with Zscaler Guest Wi‑Fi protection

Zscaler protects your guest Wi-Fi users and your company by securing the network and ensuring compliance with privacy laws and other regulations. You can set it up in a matter of minutes, because Zscaler is 100% in the cloud, so thereâs no hardware or software to deploy or manage.

Request Demo

What people say about Zscaler

Our guest lounge had its internet access terminatedâall due to a rogue guest Wi-Fi user downloading copyrighted materials that led the copyright holder to complain to our ISP. We now ensure that Zscaler is enabled on all our lounges.

Top 10 Global Airline
We want to be the most trusted retailer. So we need to provide not only a technically safe public Wi-Fi experience, but also protect our customers from inappropriate and offensive materials, which can directly link to our brand. Zscaler gives me peace of mind that we are doing everything we can with a world-leading company to protect our customers and colleagues.

Major Supermarket Chain

Suggested Resources

Zscaler Guest Wi-Fi Security

Download the Datasheet >

Is your guest Wi-Fi network secure?

Check Your Security Now >

The next generation CISO

Watch the Webinar >

Everyone expects guest Wi-Fi. But no one expects it to be risky.

For most organizations, providing guest Wi-Fi is a chance to deliver a good, seamless user experience and a positive reflection of the companyâs brand. But with that goodwill come problems that pose risks to you and your visitors.

Left unprotected, guest networks can become a liability as users download copyrighted content or otherwise inappropriate material or leak sensitive data. And visitors arenât your only concern. Employees are known to flock to the guest network to bypass security controls on the corporate networkâand those devices bouncing between secure and insecure networks can leave you exposed.

Applying security and control to the guest Wi-Fi network hasnât been easy. Youâve had to backhaul all of your internet traffic across your WAN, which is slow and costly, or deploy appliances at all of your sites, which is slower and costlier. Besides, theyâre only good for policyânot security. Another school of thought says to just get a separate broadband connection and give up on security, but no one wants their guests exposed to malware.

Request Demo

Zscaler is advanced protection made easy

With the Zscaler cloud security platform, you can protect your guest users and enforce your acceptable use policiesâno backhauling, no boxes.

All you need to do is change your DNS settings to Zscaler. Itâs that simple. And, because DNS alone is insufficient for protecting users, Zscaler intelligently routes all suspicious traffic to its cloud security platform for full inline content inspection.

Zscalerâs advanced threat protection blocks malicious active content, such as browser exploits, vulnerable ActiveX controls, malicious JavaScript, and cross-site scripting. And it inspects SSL traffic without any deterioration in performance or additional hardware or software.

Zscalerâs cloud security platform also allows you to route all of your guest Wi-Fi traffic via a GRE/IPsec tunnel for the highest level of security and compliance.

Request Demo

The intuitive and user-friendly Zscaler reporting portal
ensures that you have full visibility into your guest Wi-Fi
traffic at all locations and at all times

Drill down by location or policy to investigate the riskiest users.



Request Demo

Zscaler for guest Wi-Fi: all the protection, none of the headaches.

Set up guest Wi-Fi security in a matter of minutes—with the Zscaler cloud-based platform, thereâs no hardware or software to deploy and manage.

  • Protect your guest Wi-Fi users and your company by securing the network and ensuring compliance with privacy laws and other regulations.
  • Enable Safe Search, advanced threat protection, or SSL inspection to fit your business requirements.
  • Gain full visibility into your guest Wi-Fi traffic at all locations and at all times.
  • Drill down by location or policy to investigate the riskiest users.
  • Enjoy huge savings when compared to backhauling guest traffic or deploying appliances.
  • Set up granular, easy-to-understand policies and reporting—in minutes.

To gain fast, secure access to Zscaler Guest Wi-Fi Security, talk to Zscaler

Please provide a valid state.
  Yes, please keep me updated on Zscaler news, events, webcast and special offers.

By clicking the âGET STARTEDâ button below, you agree to our privacy policy.

For more detail on this offer, review the terms and conditions.

Thank you! We will be in touch with you shortly.

Once your request is approved, a product specialist will contact you to better understand your security goals.

Zero trust security

Make it possible

Your Mission
Products > Cloud IPS

Your apps and users have left your
network. Shouldnât your IPS?

Take intrusion prevention to a higher level
with Zscaler Cloud IPS

IPS is essential, but todayâs IPS is essentially worthless

Your network visibility is gone

Your users and apps have left the network, but your intrusion prevention system (IPS) is still sitting in the data center. Mobility and cloud migration are causing your IPS investment, and your security, to run blind.

Attacks are targeting users, not servers

IPS was designed to protect servers sitting in the data center, but intrusions now leverage the weakest link: the user. You need IPS protection built for the demands of protecting the user.

You canât afford Inspection compromises and SSL limitations

The demands of inspecting all your traffic, including SSLâwhere most threats hideâhas been a challenge for IPS. You deserve a solution without performance limitations or hardware refresh requirements.

Todayâs IPS solutions are struggling to deliver the protection they once promised.

Restore your visibility and threat protection with Zscaler Cloud IPS

Deliver always-on IPS to all your users

Cloud delivery lets you puts IPS threat protection where traditional IPS canât go. Zscaler Cloud IPS follows all your users, no matter the connection type or location, and you get the always-on threat protection and visibility you need.

Get protection built for todayâs breaches

Zscaler Cloud IPS works across a full suite of technologies like firewall, sandbox, CASB, and DLP to stop more kinds of attacks. You get complete threat protection from botnets, advanced threats, and zero-days, along with contextual information about the user, app, and threat.

Never run out of inspection capacity

Because Zscaler Cloud IPS is delivered as a service, your inspection demands scale automatically and you never run out of capacity. Best of all, you can finally inspect all your SSL traffic and stop more threats where they hide. Say goodbye to the hardware refresh!

See Our Solution View the Challenge

Zscaler Cloud IPS benefits

Unlimited capacity

Delivered across more than 100 data centers worldwide, Cloud IPS performance from any user location is lighting fast, and youâll never run out of inspection capacity

Smarter threat intelligence

The Zscaler cloud process tens of billions of requests a day from over 15 million users across global enterprises, government, and military organizations. Youâll achieve faster detections with fewer false positives

Full SSL inspection

The Zscaler Cloud IPS service fully inspects all your SSL traffic without any performance impact. Stop making inspection compromises and find more malware where it hides

Transparent updates

Zscaler Cloud IPS is constantly and transparently updated with the latest signature coverage, which eliminates change control outages

Full integration for context awareness

Cloud IPS is fully integrated into the Zscaler Security Platform. Cloud Firewall, Cloud Sandbox, CASB, and DLP work in concert to give your IPS critical information about apps, users, and files. Such context is essential for determining whether to respond to an incident and how

Simpler and more cost effective

Just point your traffic to Zscaler. There is no hardware to buy or software to manage. You get IPS protection at a fraction of the cost of traditional appliances

Stop more advanced threats with Zscaler Cloud IPS

Explore Trending Internet Threats

Zscaler Cloud IPS enables you to have all threat and alert data in one place. Full user, file and app context is available. Streaming to a SIEM allows further integration into the SOC ecosystem

The Zscaler Threat Library allows administrators and SOC personnel to drill down on IPS alerts to perform in-depth analysis of threat data within their installation. Search by vulnerability, category or keyword

The world's most trusted brands trust Zscaler

Read their stories and hear their accounts of moving security off the
network and into the cloud.

Zscaler Customers

Getting started is simple

With Zscaler Cloud Security, there is no hardware deploy or manage. By making Zscaler your next hop to the internet, youâll immediately enjoy increased security and compliance. Turn on the services you need now, and easily add more as your demands grow or as you phase out appliances.

Secure

Up-level your security and make Zscaler your next hop to the internet. It is fast to deploy and no infrastructure changes are required.

Simplify

Remove point products and phase out gateway appliances at your own pace. Reduce cost and management overhead.

Transform

Cloud-enable your network. Secure SD-WAN / local internet breakouts, optimize backhauling and deliver a better user experience.

Search form

Zero trust security

Make it possible

Your Mission

Accept nothing less than zero trust security

Watch Whatâs At Stake

Why zero trust security?

10 years ago the zero trust model was created as a way to improve application security. It seemed straight forward, ensure access to apps is always secure, that itâs based on least privilege and have visibility into all user activity. But network-centric technologies of the past made achieving zero trust security impossible, placing users on net, allowing access prior to authorization and limiting visibility to IP addresses and ports, not users. For a time the model struggled to find a foothold within IT. Until now.

Achieving Zero Trust is now possible

Modern, software-defined perimeter (SDP) services help zero trust security go from theory to practice

Reduce complexity
Gain zero trust security
Improve user experience
Standardize across all assets

As your company looks to embrace mobility and transform to the cloud, itâs up to you to ensure that apps are accessed securely. Youâll need to find a way to achieve zero trust security.

Get Your Mission Brief

Zscaler is ready to help you improve your Sandbox security

Zero trust security

Make it possible

Your Mission

Top 4 reasons to choose Zscaler over Websense

Benefit from 100% cloud-based protection, pervasive security,
and real-time reporting â at up to 80% savings over appliances.

Top 4 reasons why Zscaler is the best alternative to Websense

100% SaaS platform—a true cloud solution

With Zscalerâs multi-tenant cloud architecture, there is nothing to install and maintainâno patching, no upgrading and no vendor lock-in. As the only truly integrated cloud security platform, Zscaler is easy to set-up and scale, and is easily extended with built-in firewall and cloud-based sandboxing.


Much more than basic URL filtering

Zscalerâs high-speed, cloud-scale infrastructure offers much more than basic URL filtering. Our security services scan and filter every byte of your network traffic, including SSL-encrypted sessions, as it passes to and from the internet. Zscaler delivers carrier-grade internet security, advanced persistent threat (APT) protection, data loss prevention, SSL inspection, traffic shaping, policy management and threat intelligence through a unified cloud security platform.


Real-time, comprehensive reports

Enjoy real-time global visibility from a single administrative view. Every request from every user, location and device around the world is available in seconds in our web-based reporting and analytical tools or in your own SIEM.


Up to 80% cost savings vs. appliances

Because Zscaler is cloud-based, you can save up to 80% of the cost of deploying and managing on-premise web security appliances. And if you are backhauling your web traffic for security inspection, your MPLS costs may be reduced by up to 90%.


Get started with your Websense replacement today

Please provide a valid state.
  Yes, please keep me updated on Zscaler news, events, webcast and special offers.

By clicking the âREQUEST DEMO NOWâ button below, you agree to our privacy policy.

For more detail on this offer, review the terms and conditions.

Take action today and eliminate your security gaps with internet security that is always inline, cost-effective and easy to deploy

In comparison to traditional appliance-based approaches to internet security, Zscalerâs modern cloud-based platform delivers better security, better administrator and end-user productivity, and better economics.

  • Defense-in-depth security with Zero Day protection and sandboxing â including for encrypted SSL traffic
  • Web filtering with easy-to-use policy management
  • Global threat intelligence from over 40B transactions a day
  • Easily applied to all users, all devices, all locations â including for mobile security
  • Real-time reports for fast remediation, policy control, user management and more

Easy to add on next generation firewall, bandwidth controls and data loss prevention capabilities

Zscaler is delivered 100% in the cloud. Weâve designed an architecture thatâs easy to set up and scale and is more cost-effective than an appliance-based approach. Simply direct a portion of your traffic to us. With nothing to install or maintain, there is no patching, no upgrading â and no vendor lock-in.

To get started with Zscaler, simply direct traffic to us.

Search form

Zero trust security

Make it possible

Your Mission
Products > Data Loss Prevention

Get data loss prevention that protects
all of your users all of the time

Policies follow users on and off the network to
close the gaps in your protection

Read the eBook

Data loss prevention has become more difficult

Your data is exposed to more risks than ever

Between a lack of awareness, unintentional user actions, system glitches, and increasingly sophisticated malicious activities, you run the risk of your sensitive data being exposedâand that can cause a range of problems, from fines to customer loss, legal ramifications, and damage to your companyâs brand.

IT transformation has affected your visibility

Applications have moved to the cloud and users have left your network, connecting direct-to-cloud. That creates a significant blind spot, as users bypass gateway security controls, allowing sensitive information to flow out of your networkâor when that data is hidden in SSL traffic that you canât fully inspect.

You are mandated by compliance requirements

Various data protection regulationsâPCI, HIPAA, and GDPRârequire you to put measures in place that protect sensitive information on your network and prevent it from being exposed to unauthorized parties.

Close the gaps in your data protection strategy with Zscaler Cloud DLP

Protect your data

Protect personally identifiable information (PII), personal health information (PHI), and intellectual property from loss with advanced features such as Exact Data Match (EDM), machine learning, and granular policies for optimal protection.

Illuminate your blind spots

Zscaler Cloud DLP policy follows your users on-network and off, always protecting you against data loss. Zscaler inspects all your traffic inline, including SSL, and gives you the protection and visibility youâve been missing.

Be compliant

The Zscaler cloud security platform was built with compliance in mind, offering you an essential tool for complying with all major regulations. Leverage the built-in dictionaries and engines to make data protection painless.

See Our Solution View the Challenge

Zscaler Cloud DLP benefits

Identical protection on-network or off

Provide the same level of security to all your users by moving your data security to the cloud. Zscaler sits between your users and the applications they are connecting to. Cloud DLP policy follows users where they workâon- or off-networkâand provides the same level of protection to all users at all times.

Full SSL inspection of all traffic

Donât settle for partial inspection of your traffic. Around 70% of outbound traffic is encrypted and thus not subject to inspection by traditional DLP solutions. With Zscaler, there are no capacity constraints for enabling SSL interception at scale. Zscaler is a proxy by design, performing SSL inspection on all traffic, without the inspection limitations of appliances.

Elastic scale with inline enforcement

Make prevention, not remediation, your number-one priority. Zscaler is architected to sit inline, so it can block sensitive information before it leaves your networkâinstead of being limited to damage control after data has been compromised. The Zscaler security architecture was built in the cloud from the ground up and the service is user-based, not capacity-based, allowing your Cloud DLP inspection to scale elastically with performance guaranteed by SLAs.

Fully integrated platform service

Roll out DLP in minutes, not months. No architectural changes are needed to implement Cloud DLP because it is part of the Zscaler Security Platform, a fully integrated security stack as a service. Zscaler eliminates redundancies of managing various appliances, reducing the resources needed to stand up and maintain point products.

Is your data loss prevention solution effective? Find out with Zscaler Security Preview.

Check Now

Improve incident detection with Exact Data Match (EDM)

With Zscaler EDM, you can fingerprint and match up to one billion cells of your unique sensitive data inline. Those fingerprints will be stored in the Zscaler cloud to give you the ability to stop data loss globally and at scale. EDM dramatically increases your detection accuracy of exfiltration attempts. Instead of spending your time combing through your incident notifications and looking for the needle in the haystack, you can now focus on the remediation of actual data loss incidents.

Set up EDM in minutes:
  1. Download the Zscaler Index Tool.
  2. Import a CSV file with your data.
  3. The Index Tool hashes the data and stores it as an EDM template in the Zscaler cloud. Your plain text data never leaves your premises.
  4. In your UI, apply the EDM template to a policy.
Watch Demo

Ensure compliance with granular policy controls

Maximize your data protection even as you maintain compliance with industry mandates, such as HIPAA, as well as data privacy regulations like GDPR. Leveraging an extensive feature set, including EDM, machine learning, file type control, and granular policy that follows the user, Cloud DLP simplifies compliance with regional regulations.

Investigate data loss incidents in real time

With Zscaler Cloud DLP, you can instantly analyze and report on any compliance concern. With visibility into each DLP violation, you can customize your notification workflow and reporting. Zscaler Nanolog Streaming Service (NSS) can also forward logs in real time to your third-party DLP solution via secure ICAP, or feed into your SIEM to integrate with your governance, risk, and compliance (GRC) workflowsâbuying you crucial time for analysis and remediation of data loss incidents.

The Largest Security Cloud in the world

60 billion transactions per day at peak periods

100 million threats detected per day

120,000 unique security updates per day

  • 100 data centers in 6 continents
  • Redundancy within and failover data centers
  • Internet exchange peering with 150+ vendors including Office 365, AWS, Azure

More Details

Zero trust security

Make it possible

Your Mission

Vulnerability Disclosure Program

Last Updated: August 15, 2018

Introduction

The information on this page is intended for security researchers interested in responsibly reporting security vulnerabilities to the Zscaler securityÂ team.

Security requires transformation and there is no better way to transform a security program than to engage directly with our customers and users. It is that engagement, along with a strong belief in the collaboration with the security community, that is the key to maintaining a secure environment for all of our users. If you believe you've discovered a security vulnerability on or within a Zscaler product, service, or application, we strongly encourage you to inform us as quickly as possible. We ask that such vulnerability reports be kept private and researchers not make those public until we have resolved theÂ issue.

In return, we will work to review reports and respond in a timely manner. Our bug bounty partner, Bugcrowd, will engage with you initially to triage your submission. Zscaler will not seek judicial or law enforcement remedies against you for identifying security issues, so long as you (1) comply with the policies set forth herein; (2) comply with BugcrowdâsÂ Standard Disclosure Terms;Â (3) do not compromise the safety or privacy of our users; and (4) do not destroy any sensitive data you might have gathered from Zscaler as part of your research once issues areÂ resolved.

Thanks for your help!

Vulnerability Program Scope & Rules

In Scope

We are primarily interested in hearing about the following vulnerabilityÂ categories:

  • Sensitive Data Exposure â Cross Site Scripting (XSS) Stored, SQL Injection (SQLi),Â etc.
  • Authentication or Session Management relatedÂ issues
  • Remote Code Execution
  • Particularly clever vulnerabilities or unique issues that do not fall into explicit categories - Â show us your fancyÂ footwork!
Out of Scope

The following vulnerability categories are considered out of scope of our responsible disclosure program and should be avoided byÂ researchers.

  • Denial of Service (DoS) â Either through network traffic, resources exhaustion orÂ others
  • User enumeration
  • Issues only present in old browsers/old plugins/end-of-life softwareÂ browsers
  • Phishing or social engineering of Zscaler employees, users orÂ clients
  • Systems or issues that relate to Third-Party technology used byÂ Zscaler
  • Disclosure of known public files and other information disclosures that are not a material risk (e.g.:Â robots.txt)
  • Any attack or vulnerability that hinges on a userâs computer firstÂ being compromised

Please note that you are expected to engage in security research responsibly. For example, if you discover a publicly exposed password or key, you should not use the key to test the extent of access it grants or to download or exfiltrate data in order to prove it is an active key. Similarly, if you discover a successful SQL injection, you are expected not to exploit the vulnerability beyond any initial steps needed to demonstrate yourÂ proof-of-concept.

Excessive exfiltration or downloading of Zscaler data, or demanding payment in return for destruction of Zscaler data, will be considered outside of the scope of this program, and Zscaler will reserve all of its rights, remedies, and actions to protect itself and itsÂ users.

Vulnerability Rewards

Our public program currently does not provide any monetary reward beyond Zscalerâs eternal gratitude. If you are a Bugcrowd researcher, you can also claim your submission below for kudos. If you are interested in helping us in a more dedicated manner as a security researcher in our Private Program, please contactÂ security@zscaler.com with your request andÂ justification.

At Zscalerâs sole discretion, we may make exceptions to this policy for exceptionalÂ contributions.

Reporting a Security Vulnerability

Please use this form to report security vulnerabilities to Zscaler through our Bugcrowd partner portal. Zscaler generally scores vulnerability based on Bugcrowdâs Vulnerability Rating Taxonomy (VRT).

Your Mission
Partners > Zscaler for ISPs

Zscaler Cloud Security Solution for ISPs

Zscaler Service Provider Partners

Todayâs service providers are going well beyond basic internet service to deliver a variety ofÂ  managed security services for enterprise customers. However, as more businesses embrace the trends of mobility and BYOD, cloud applications and social media, protecting static resources is no longer enough. Corporate firewalls were not designed to protect the growing number of mobile users and distributed branch offices that are the new normal in todayâs enterprise IT environments.

Zscalerâs Direct-to-Cloud Network offers service providers a better solution. With Zscaler, service providers can differentiate their services by delivering the industryâs most advanced security, while enabling their enterprise clients for the challenges of mobile security, cloud applications and social media. Because Zscaler requires no hardware or software to purchase, install or maintain, there is no CapEx investment in appliances or any ongoing investment to manage the cloud security services.

Deploying Zscaler Internet Access and Zscaler Private Access for Fortune 500 organizations

Deploying Zscaler to Global 2000 including NHS

Deploying Zscaler for global organizations

Rolled out Zscaler service in multiple markets including Spain, Latin America and Eastern Europe

Deploying Zscaler for large enterprises.

Advantages

Zscalerâs white label offers service provides a ready to go cloud security infrastructure, giving the provider the ability to offer a full suite of security services, with full control of policy administration and reporting, including:

  • Cloud Web Security: protect enterprise users from advanced and emerging threats including botnets, malware, phishing attacks and more, and securely enable cloud applications and social media.
  • Cloud-enabled Networking: secure branch offices and road warriors without backhauling traffic to a central gateway, and deliver a transparent, latency-free experience to users.
  • Cloud Mobile Security: go beyond mobile device management and enable enterprise clients for BYOD with Mobile Security that offers comprehensive protection for smartphones and tablets, with no software to install or update.

Benefits

  • Gets providers out of the systems integration business: with Zscaler, service providers can focus on delivering advanced cloud security services, and eliminate the time and costs of integrating different vendor solutions.
  • Reduce CapEx: with no hardware or software to purchase, Zscalerâs cloud security solution and services offers service providers a distinct advantage over traditional security appliances.
  • Reduce ongoing management cost: Zscalerâs cloud security solution is always up to date, and eliminates the cost and hassles of maintaining and upgrading hardware and software based solutions.
  • Lower TCO: Zscaler offers lower cost of ownership, providing better margins for service providers on managed security services.
  • Global coverage for large clients: with over 100 data centers worldwide, Zscaler is built on a massive, distributed security cloud that offers global coverage, making it easy and cost-effective to provide services to global enterprises.
  • Unified Policy Console: You already provide clients with security services for laptops, but what about their smartphones and tablets? Zscalerâs unified policy console makes it easy to define a single, consistent policy across multiple devices and applications.
  • Advanced Security Analytics: Our patented NanoLogâ¢ technology uses advanced compression techniques to provide consolidated reporting and analysis across devices, locations and users in real time. Learn more about Zscaler Real-time Reporting here.
  • One Secure Solution for Web and Mobile: The cost and complexities of purchasing and managing multiple point security appliances can quickly eat into the profits of your managed service offerings. With Zscaler, you can replace multiple point products with a single, seamless solution that integrates cloud web security and cloud mobile security, with no hardware or software required.

Ready to transform your company?

Zscaler security is so comprehensive, you can forget about it. See for yourself.
